EOD Processing and Fund Switch

How to run End of Day (EOD) processing and switch funds between accounts in Unit Master.

EOD Processing

EOD stands for End of Day. EOD processing is designed to tie up all the operations for a financial day and prepare the system for the next day.

A user can run EOD for a single client or for all clients. It also allows the user to run the EOD process for a single date or for a selected period.

Step One: Open the EOD Processing page

Go to the Operations menu, then click on the EOD Processing sub menu.

Step Two: Search for the member

Use the Search button at the top of the page to look for a member. Then select the member’s details from the dropdown menu below it.

Step Three: Enter EOD parameters

Key in the required details in the fields provided, for example:

  • Date – single date or period
  • Funds to be processed

Once the user has set all the parameters, they click on the Compute button.

Step Four: Complete the EOD process

The user confirms the details and clicks on the Compute button to complete the EOD process.

Fund Switch

The Fund Switch function allows the user to move funds from one fund to another within the same member account.

Step One: Open the Fund Switch page

Go to the Transactions menu, then click on the Fund Switch sub menu.

Step Two: Select the member

Initiate a switch by:

  • Searching for the member using the Search button on the top left side.
  • Selecting the member’s details from the dropdown button on the top right side.
Step Three: Choose date and accounts

Select:

  • The transaction date.
  • The account funds are moving from.
  • The account funds are moving to.

The user can also create a new account for the member by clicking the New Account button. A pop up appears and the user populates the fields with the required details.

Step Four: Select switch type and reason

Select the switch type:

  • Move all funds, or
  • Move partial funds.

Enter a reason for the switch and, if needed, add a short narrative explaining the reason.

Step Five: Submit and confirm

Click the Submit button. A confirmation window appears. Once the user confirms the switch, the transaction is complete.
